channel.title: Small port forward problem!
channel.description: I used to be port forwarded perfectly, had players and everything, but now it's specifically the 43594 port. I have other ports forwarded and I used PFPortChecker to check, and the other ports are forwarded, but 43594 isn't, but it's on the router. Help anyone? I added a rule for it through my firewall and everything, and I have no anti-virus blocking it.

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

MAKE SURE THAT YOUR SOURCE IS RUNNING WHILE U CHECK!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

I am having a similar problem. I have portforwaded in my router for the TCP and UDP to port 43594. I have shut all firewalls off to check it and so on. PfPortChecker tells me that the TCP port is open but the UDP port is not. How do I get that UDP port open? I have a Minecraft Server in which I portforawrded the exact same way. It is still working perfectly and the PfPortChecker says both UDP and TCP are open. Its just the UDP port on port 43594

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

Tutorial:

I don’t understand how every other port is forwarded except 43594, which basically means your firewall for inbound and outbound connections is disabled or allowing any connection to go in and out.

Well that can’t be it, I enabled it already.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I don’t understand how every other port is forwarded except 43594, which basically means your firewall for inbound and outbound connections is disabled or allowing any connection to go in and out.

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Go to http://www.canyouseeme.org/

Type in your port and hit check. If it says it can’t see you, then you haven’t forwarded the port correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

RGxxTime:

Do you have the server ruining while checking the port? Mine is like that. The server or whatever taking that port needs to be running while checking.

I’ve done it with it running and without, and I’ve made sure that everything was closed before I checked too.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

b b0yz 4:

I have had that problem before, and have done all of these things before as well. I honestly don’t know how I fixed it. Just let your PC and router generate your IPv4. Don’t set it yourself.

Well if I let it generate itself, it’ll just keep changing and it won’t work even if they’re the same. It’s weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

I have had that problem before, and have done all of these things before as well. I honestly don’t know how I fixed it. Just let your PC and router generate your IPv4. Don’t set it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

b b0yz 4:

Try restarting your router AND your PC, and if your IP changes then change the IP in your router settings.

I’ve done all of that, but one thing is that the IP won’t change, because I went into my IPv4 adress and set it myself. Like basically, I don’t know why it’s not working, because I had it forwarded the other day, and at the moment I have other ports forwarded, and yes I checked to see if they really were, but 43594 specifically won’t go through.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Try restarting your router AND your PC, and if your IP changes then change the IP in your router settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

b b0yz 4:

Make sure you have it for both TCP and UDP in the router settings and in your firewall. You might have to create two separate rules for the TCP and UDP.

I did that too.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Make sure you have it for both TCP and UDP in the router settings and in your firewall. You might have to create two separate rules for the TCP and UDP.

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:3, topic:469973”]Make sure you have the right IP address in your port forward. A lot of times our IPs will change if the router gets shut off or is reset, so if this ever happens again:

  1. Go to the CMD prompt.
  2. Type ipconfig
  3. Find your IPv4 or IPv6 which ever one is 192.168.something.something
  4. Make sure that IP is the same as the one placed in your router settings.[/quote]

It is the right ip, and I even set the ip myself so it didn’t change, because it used to. So it’s not the ip. And yes, I have someone else trying it (my brother)

Read full topic

item.title: Small port forward problem!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Make sure you have the right IP address in your port forward. A lot of times our IPs will change if the router gets shut off or is reset, so if this ever happens again:

  1. Go to the CMD prompt.
  2. Type ipconfig
  3. Find your IPv4 or IPv6 which ever one is 192.168.something.something
  4. Make sure that IP is the same as the one placed in your router settings.

Read full topic
